references.paper_title: Flamingo: a visual language model for few-shot learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Flamingo, a foundational visual language model that significantly influenced the design of TextHarmony.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, serves as the visual encoder in TextHarmony, a key component for visual text comprehension and generation.
This paper's introduction of denoising diffusion probabilistic models underpins the image generation capabilities of TextHarmony.

references.paper_title: Lora: Low-rank adaptation of large language models
references.reason: The Slide-LoRA module in TextHarmony is based on LoRA, which is described in this paper, enhancing model efficiency and multimodal generation.

references.paper_title: MM-Interleaved: Interleaved image-text generative modeling via multi-modal feature synchronizer
references.reason: TextHarmony's architecture is built upon the MM-Interleaved model, which enables the unified processing of visual and textual information.
